greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let u(1)=u(2)=u(3)=2, u(n)=(1+u(n-1)u(n-2))/u(n-3) then a(n) is the denominator of u(n).
comment: The sequence 2,1,4,2,8,... has a(n)=2^(n/2)(1+2sqrt(2)-(1-2sqrt(2))(-1)^n)/(2sqrt(2)) and is essentially the pair-reversal of A016116. - _Paul Barry_, Apr 26 2004
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,2).
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Nov 24 2002
